content.description:
Misfit climbs a short overhang via big moves on good stone over an equally good landing.

Sit start with hands matched on the good sidepull. From there, gain a big right hand edge, put a heel in the start hold, reach a left hand edge, bump the right hand up to the edge above, move the left over to the good edge below, stick a blind sloper around the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is very good.
content.location:
It climbs just to the right of

Conjugal Visit

on Misfit's south face.

content.description:
French Press traverses the lip of Misfit's bulging overhang on an assortment of bumps and slopers. Tension is required.

Sit start with hands matched on an edge at the boulder's lower right corner of the south face. From there, traverse left through the early slopers and later bumps, and top it out to the left of the apex (slightly awkward with the mini-boulder that lies there).
content.protection: A few pads or someone to move them would be great. The landing is pretty good though, it's clear and mostly flat.
content.location: It traverses the entire south facing lip of Misfit Boulder.

content.description:
Stand start with two sidepulls at waist height.  From there, make a crux move to a sharp left hand crimp, situate, and move slightly right (left bale out is off) to the lip and the subsequent topout.

This is short but surprisingly fun.
content.protection: Pad and spot, landing is good though.
content.location: This is on the South face of the Misfit Boulder.
